text_structure.notes: Chapter breaks identified during kernel creation

structure_detection.notes: Numbered chapters detected from I to XXXVIII with Conclusion

exposition.rationale: This section establishes Jane's character, background, and initial circumstances as an orphaned child living with the hostile Reed family at Gateshead. The opening chapters introduce her defiant nature and set up the foundational conflicts that will drive the narrative forward.

rising_action.rationale: This extensive section develops Jane's relationship with Rochester through increasingly complex interactions, building romantic and psychological tension. The mysterious events at Thornfield, Jane's internal conflicts about her feelings, and the introduction of Blanche Ingram as a rival create mounting dramatic pressure.

climax.rationale: The interrupted wedding ceremony and revelation of Rochester's existing marriage to Bertha Mason represents the story's turning point and moment of peak tension. Jane's moral crisis and decision to leave Rochester despite their mutual love creates the central dramatic crisis of the novel.

falling_action.rationale: This section follows the consequences of Jane's decision as she discovers her family connections with the Rivers siblings and inherits her uncle's fortune. The exploration of her relationship with St. John Rivers and his marriage proposal creates new conflicts while resolving her financial independence.

resolution.rationale: The final chapters provide thematic closure as Jane returns to Rochester as an independent woman, finding him changed by tragedy but free to marry. Their reunion and marriage represent the resolution of both romantic and social conflicts established throughout the novel.

voice.pov_description: First person narration throughout - 'I' narrator telling her own story
voice.focalization_description: Limited to Jane's internal perspective and consciousness

structure.plot_architecture_description: Single plot following Jane's journey from childhood to marriage

voice.tone: Passionate yet controlled, moral indignation tempered by Christian forbearance

device_mediation.summary: Gothic and Romantic devices accumulate throughout the narrative to support Jane's transformative journey from powerless orphan to empowered woman, with heightened literary techniques at climactic moments reinforcing the novel's challenge to Victorian social hierarchies and gender roles

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Grace Poole, in prim cap, white apron
micro_devices.scene: Jane observes Grace Poole's mysterious routine during party preparations
micro_devices.effect: Hints at the hidden secrets of Thornfield that will become crucial to the plot's development

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: almost as noiselessly as a bright mist
micro_devices.scene: The elegant ladies descend the staircase
micro_devices.effect: Emphasizes the ethereal, otherworldly quality of the upper-class guests from Jane's perspective

micro_devices.name: Situational Irony
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I did not expect him to come and speak to me
micro_devices.scene: Jane observes Rochester in the drawing room with his guests
micro_devices.effect: Highlights the painful reversal from their previous intimate moments to current social distance

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: eyes that revealed a heart full and eager to overflow
micro_devices.scene: Jane recalls her last intimate moment with Rochester
micro_devices.effect: Creates vivid contrast between past emotional connection and present social estrangement

micro_devices.name: Personification
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: the moon was setting in the waves, broad and red, like a hot cannon-ball
micro_devices.scene: Rochester's description of the tempestuous West Indian night
micro_devices.effect: Creates an ominous, violent atmosphere that mirrors his internal torment

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: A wind fresh from Europe blew over the ocean
micro_devices.scene: The moment of Rochester's spiritual renewal and decision
micro_devices.effect: Wind represents hope, purification, and new possibilities for his future

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless
micro_devices.scene: Jane's internal monologue about moral principles
micro_devices.effect: Contrasts her isolation with her moral strength, highlighting her resolve

micro_devices.name: Simile
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: powerless as stubble exposed to the draught and glow of a furnace
micro_devices.scene: Rochester's physical grip on Jane during final confrontation
micro_devices.effect: Emphasizes Jane's physical vulnerability while preparing for her spiritual strength

micro_devices.name: Hyperbole
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: All happiness will be torn away with you
micro_devices.scene: Rochester's desperate plea to Jane not to leave
micro_devices.effect: Amplifies the emotional stakes and Rochester's desperation at the climax

micro_devices.name: Dramatic Irony
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I comprehended how he should despise himself
micro_devices.scene: Jane observes St. John and realizes the nature of his character and his relationship with Miss Oliver
micro_devices.effect: Jane's insight into St. John's self-conflict creates tension while revealing her growing understanding of human nature

micro_devices.name: First-Person Narration
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I now clapped my hands in sudden joy
micro_devices.scene: Jane's emotional response to discovering her family connections
micro_devices.effect: Provides intimate access to Jane's internal emotional transformation, allowing readers to experience her joy and resolution directly

micro_devices.name: Verbal Irony
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Famous equality and fraternization! Close union! Intimate attachment!
micro_devices.scene: Jane sarcastically responds to St. John's suggestion that they can be family without sharing the inheritance
micro_devices.effect: Exposes the hollowness of relationships based on inequality, reinforcing Jane's insistence on true equity

micro_devices.name: Parallelism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: they were scattered—I could reunite them
micro_devices.scene: Jane realizes how she can use her inheritance to benefit her newfound family
micro_devices.effect: Creates rhythmic emphasis on Jane's power to transform her family's circumstances, highlighting her agency in the resolution
